articles.title: French Jealousy & Trust Phrases for English Speakers
articles.content:
Jealousy and trust are delicate topics that require careful communication. When you're with a French speaker, knowing how to discuss these feelings in their language shows emotional depth. Here are essential French phrases for these important conversations.

## Expressing Jealousy

### Je suis jaloux/jalouse
**Pronunciation:** zhuh swee zhah-LOO/zhah-LOOZ

**Meaning:** "I'm jealous"

**When to use it:** To honestly admit your feelings. Use "jaloux" if male, "jalouse" if female.

### Je deviens jaloux/jalouse quand...
**Pronunciation:** zhuh duh-VYEHN zhah-LOO/zhah-LOOZ kahn

**Meaning:** "I get jealous when..."

**When to use it:** To explain what triggers your jealousy.

**Example:** "Je deviens jalouse quand tu parles avec elle." (I get jealous when you talk with her.)

### Je n'aime pas ressentir cette jalousie
**Pronunciation:** zhuh nem pah ruh-sahn-TEER set zhah-loo-ZEE

**Meaning:** "I don't like feeling this jealousy"

**When to use it:** To show self-awareness about your jealousy.

## Seeking Reassurance

### Est-ce que tu m'aimes vraiment?
**Pronunciation:** ess kuh too mem vreh-MAHN

**Meaning:** "Do you really love me?"

**When to use it:** When seeking reassurance about your partner's love.

### J'ai besoin que tu me rassures
**Pronunciation:** zhay buh-ZWAHN kuh too muh rah-SOOR

**Meaning:** "I need you to reassure me"

**When to use it:** When asking for verbal comfort.

### Peux-tu m'aider √† me sentir plus en s√©curit√©?
**Pronunciation:** puh-too meh-DAY ah muh sahn-TEER ploo ahn say-koo-ree-TAY

**Meaning:** "Can you help me feel more secure?"

**When to use it:** To ask for support with insecurities.

## Building Trust

### J'ai confiance en toi
**Pronunciation:** zhay kohn-FYAHNS ahn twah

**Meaning:** "I trust you"

**When to use it:** To express trust directly.

### Je veux te faire enti√®rement confiance
**Pronunciation:** zhuh vuh tuh fair ahn-tyair-MAHN kohn-FYAHNS

**Meaning:** "I want to trust you completely"

**When to use it:** When working toward deeper trust.

### Comment peut-on construire plus de confiance?
**Pronunciation:** koh-MAHN puh-TOHN kohn-STRWEER ploo duh kohn-FYAHNS

**Meaning:** "How can we build more trust?"

**When to use it:** To work on strengthening trust together.

## Giving Reassurance

### Je n'ai d'yeux que pour toi
**Pronunciation:** zhuh nay DYUH kuh poor twah

**Meaning:** "I only have eyes for you"

**When to use it:** A romantic way to reassure your partner.

### Tu es le seul/la seule pour moi
**Pronunciation:** too eh luh suhl/lah suhl poor mwah

**Meaning:** "You're the only one for me"

**When to use it:** To affirm your commitment.

### Tu n'as pas √† t'inqui√©ter
**Pronunciation:** too nah pah ah tahn-kyay-TAY

**Meaning:** "You don't have to worry"

**When to use it:** To calm your partner's concerns.

### Mon c≈ìur t'appartient
**Pronunciation:** mohn kur tah-par-TYEHN

**Meaning:** "My heart belongs to you"

**When to use it:** A romantic declaration.

## Setting Healthy Boundaries

### La jalousie affecte notre relation
**Pronunciation:** lah zhah-loo-ZEE ah-FEKT notr ruh-lah-SYOHN

**Meaning:** "Jealousy is affecting our relationship"

**When to use it:** When jealousy becomes problematic.

### J'ai besoin de mon espace personnel
**Pronunciation:** zhay buh-ZWAHN duh mohn eh-SPAHS pair-soh-NEL

**Meaning:** "I need my personal space"

**When to use it:** To establish healthy boundaries.

### La confiance est essentielle pour moi
**Pronunciation:** lah kohn-FYAHNS eh teh-sahn-SYEL poor mwah

**Meaning:** "Trust is essential for me"

**When to use it:** To express your values.

## Cultural Notes

French culture values emotional intelligence and the ability to discuss feelings openly. Jealousy ("la jalousie") is seen as human but should be managed maturely.

Trust ("la confiance") is considered foundational to love. Building it requires consistent honesty and respect for each other's autonomy.

The French appreciate nuance in emotional conversations. Taking time to express yourself fully is valued over rushing through difficult topics.

## Nurturing Your Bond

Discussing jealousy and trust in French deepens your emotional connection. These conversations, though vulnerable, show your commitment to growing together. "La confiance se construit jour apr√®s jour" (Trust is built day after day).

<PhraseOfDay

  translation="–Ø —Ç–µ–±—è –ª—é–±–ª—é"
  context="–°–∞–º–æ–µ –≤–∞–∂–Ω–æ–µ –≤—ã—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ —ç–º–æ—Ü–∏–π –Ω–∞ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–º —è–∑—ã–∫–µ"

## –ü–æ—á–µ–º—É –≤–∞–∂–Ω–æ –≤—ã—Ä–∞–∂–∞—Ç—å —ç–º–æ—Ü–∏–∏ –Ω–∞ —è–∑—ã–∫–µ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä–∞

–í –º–µ–∂–∫—É–ª—å—Ç—É—Ä–Ω—ã—Ö –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è—Ö –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ —ç–º–æ—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ —è–∑—ã–∫–∞ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä–∞ –∫—Ä–∏—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏ –≤–∞–∂–Ω–æ. –ö–æ–≥–¥–∞ –≤—ã –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç–µ –≤—ã—Ä–∞–∑–∏—Ç—å —Å–≤–æ–∏ —á—É–≤—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –Ω–∞ –µ–≥–æ —Ä–æ–¥–Ω–æ–º —è–∑—ã–∫–µ, —ç—Ç–æ —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞—ë—Ç –æ—Å–æ–±—É—é –±–ª–∏–∑–æ—Å—Ç—å.

## –ü–æ–ª–æ–∂–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ —ç–º–æ—Ü–∏–∏

### –†–∞–¥–æ—Å—Ç—å –∏ —Å—á–∞—Å—Ç—å–µ

<VocabCard
  word="I'm happy"
  translation="–Ø —Å—á–∞—Å—Ç–ª–∏–≤(–∞)"

<CultureTip flag="üá¨üáß" title="–í—ã—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Ä–∞–¥–æ—Å—Ç–∏">
–í –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–º –∫—É–ª—å—Ç—É—Ä–µ —ç–º–æ—Ü–∏–∏ –≤—ã—Ä–∞–∂–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –ø–æ-—Å–≤–æ–µ–º—É. –ü–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ —ç—Ç–∏—Ö –Ω—é–∞–Ω—Å–æ–≤ –ø–æ–º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –≤–∞–º –ª—É—á—à–µ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞—Ç—å –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä–∞.
</CultureTip>

### –õ—é–±–æ–≤—å –∏ –ø—Ä–∏–≤—è–∑–∞–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å

<VocabCard
  word="I love you"

  exampleTranslation="–Ø –ª—é–±–ª—é —Ç–µ–±—è –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ –Ω–∞ —Å–≤–µ—Ç–µ."
/>

<VocabCard

  example="I miss you so much."
  exampleTranslation="–Ø –æ—á–µ–Ω—å —Å–∫—É—á–∞—é –ø–æ —Ç–µ–±–µ."
/>

## –ù–µ–≥–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–µ —ç–º–æ—Ü–∏–∏

–í–∞–∂–Ω–æ —É–º–µ—Ç—å –≤—ã—Ä–∞–∂–∞—Ç—å –∏ –Ω–µ–≥–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–µ —á—É–≤—Å—Ç–≤–∞ ‚Äî —ç—Ç–æ —á–∞—Å—Ç—å –∑–¥–æ—Ä–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ –æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏—è.

### –ì—Ä—É—Å—Ç—å

<VocabCard
  word="I'm sad"
  translation="–ú–Ω–µ –≥—Ä—É—Å—Ç–Ω–æ"
  example="I'm sad."
  exampleTranslation="–ú–Ω–µ –≥—Ä—É—Å—Ç–Ω–æ."
/>

<CultureTip flag="üá¨üáß" title="–í—ã—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ –Ω–µ–≥–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã—Ö —ç–º–æ—Ü–∏–π">
–í –∑–¥–æ—Ä–æ–≤—ã—Ö –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è—Ö –≤–∞–∂–Ω–æ —É–º–µ—Ç—å –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç—å –æ –ª—é–±—ã—Ö —á—É–≤—Å—Ç–≤–∞—Ö. –≠—Ç–æ –ø–æ–º–æ–≥–∞–µ—Ç –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä—É –ª—É—á—à–µ –≤–∞—Å –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞—Ç—å.
</CultureTip>

## –ö–∞–∫ —Å–ø—Ä–æ—Å–∏—Ç—å –æ —á—É–≤—Å—Ç–≤–∞—Ö –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä–∞

<VocabCard

  exampleTranslation="–ö–∞–∫ —É —Ç–µ–±—è –¥–µ–ª–∞?"
/>

## –°–ª–æ–≤–∞ –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∫–∏ –∏ —É—Ç–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è

–ö–æ–≥–¥–∞ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä —Ä–∞—Å—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω, –≤–∞–∂–Ω–æ —É–º–µ—Ç—å –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞—Ç—å –µ–≥–æ –Ω–∞ –µ–≥–æ —Ä–æ–¥–Ω–æ–º —è–∑—ã–∫–µ:

| Forever yours | –í—Å–µ–≥–¥–∞ —Ç–≤–æ–π/—Ç–≤–æ—è |

  title="–£—á–∏—Ç–µ —è–∑—ã–∫ —ç–º–æ—Ü–∏–π –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ"

/>

## –°–≤—è–∑–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å–∏

- [–ö–æ–º–ø–ª–∏–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ã –Ω–∞ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–º —è–∑—ã–∫–µ](/ru/blog/english-giving-compliments)

articles.title: Salutations et au revoir en hongrois : guide complet
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Les salutations hongroises varient selon le moment et le niveau de formalit√©. Voici comment saluer correctement.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Szia!"
  translation="Salut ! (bonjour ET au revoir)"
  pronunciation="SI-o"
  context="La salutation polyvalente - fonctionne pour arriver et partir !"
/>

## Salutations informelles

<VocabCard
  word="Szia!"
  translation="Salut !"
  pronunciation="SI-o"
  example="Bonjour ET au revoir"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Sziasztok!"
  translation="Salut ! (pluriel)"
  pronunciation="SI-os-tok"
  example="Pour plusieurs personnes"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Hell√≥!"
  translation="Hello !"
  pronunciation="H√àL-lo"
  example="Emprunt√© √† l'anglais"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Szia, √©desem!"
  translation="Salut, mon/ma ch√©ri(e) !"
  pronunciation="SI-o √âI-d√®-ch√®m"
  example="Pour votre partenaire"
/>

## Salutations formelles

<VocabCard
  word="J√≥ napot k√≠v√°nok"
  translation="Bonjour (je vous souhaite)"
  pronunciation="yo NO-pot KII-va-nok"
  example="La salutation formelle standard"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="J√≥ reggelt"
  translation="Bonjour (matin)"
  pronunciation="yo R√àG-g√®lt"
  example="Jusqu'√† environ 9-10h"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="J√≥ est√©t"
  translation="Bonsoir"
  pronunciation="yo √àCH-t√©it"
  example="√Ä partir de 18h environ"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="√údv√∂zl√∂m"
  translation="Je vous salue"
  pronunciation="UD-veu-zleum"
  example="Tr√®s formel"
/>

<CultureTip title="Kez√©t cs√≥kolom" flag="üá≠üá∫">
La salutation traditionnelle ¬´ Kez√©t cs√≥kolom ¬ª (Je baise votre main) √©tait autrefois utilis√©e par les hommes envers les femmes et les enfants envers les adultes. Aujourd'hui, elle reste utilis√©e par les personnes √¢g√©es et dans certains contextes formels.
</CultureTip>

## Demander comment √ßa va

<VocabCard
  word="Hogy vagy?"
  translation="Comment vas-tu ?"
  pronunciation="hody vody"
  example="Informel (tutoiement)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Hogy van?"
  translation="Comment allez-vous ?"
  pronunciation="hody von"
  example="Formel (vouvoiement)"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Mi √∫js√°g?"
  translation="Quoi de neuf ?"
  pronunciation="mi OU√è-chag"
  example="Tr√®s d√©contract√©"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Minden rendben?"
  translation="Tout va bien ?"
  pronunciation="MIN-d√®n R√àND-b√®n"
  example="Prendre des nouvelles"
/>

### R√©ponses

| Hongrois | Prononciation | Fran√ßais |
|----------|---------------|----------|
| **J√≥l vagyok, k√∂sz√∂n√∂m** | yol VO-dyok KEU-seu-neum | Bien, merci |
| **Remek√ºl** | R√à-m√®-kul | Super |
| **Megvagyok** | M√àG-vo-dyok | √áa va |
| **√ögy-ahogy** | oudy O-hody | Comme ci comme √ßa |
| **Nem valami j√≥l** | n√®m VO-lo-mi yol | Pas tr√®s bien |

## Au revoir

### Informel

<VocabCard
  word="Szia!"
  translation="Salut ! / Bye !"
  pronunciation="SI-o"
  example="Le plus polyvalent"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="P√°! / P√°p√°!"
  translation="Bye !"
  pronunciation="pa / PA-pa"
  example="D√©contract√©"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Majd tal√°lkozunk!"
  translation="On se voit !"
  pronunciation="moyd TA-lal-ko-zounk"
  example="√Ä bient√¥t"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Viszl√°t!"
  translation="Au revoir !"
  pronunciation="VIS-lat"
  example="Version courte de ¬´ Viszontl√°t√°sra ¬ª"
/>

### Formel

<VocabCard
  word="Viszontl√°t√°sra"
  translation="Au revoir"
  pronunciation="VI-sont-LA-ta-chro"
  example="La forme polie compl√®te"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Sz√©p napot"
  translation="Bonne journ√©e"
  pronunciation="s√©ip NO-pot"
  example="Souhait en partant"
/>

### Romantique

<VocabCard
  word="Cs√≥k!"
  translation="Bisou !"
  pronunciation="tchok"
  example="Tendre"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Puszi!"
  translation="Bisou ! (mignon)"
  pronunciation="POU-si"
  example="Affectueux"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Holnap tal√°lkozunk, sz√≠vem"
  translation="On se voit demain, mon c≈ìur"
  pronunciation="HOL-nop TA-lal-ko-zounk SII-v√®m"
  example="Pour un au revoir romantique"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="J√≥ √©jszak√°t, sz√©p √°lmokat"
  translation="Bonne nuit, fais de beaux r√™ves"
  pronunciation="yo √âI√è-so-kat s√©ip AL-mo-kot"
  example="Avant de dormir"
/>

<CultureTip title="L'usage de ¬´ Szia ¬ª" flag="üá≠üá∫">
¬´ Szia ¬ª est magique car il fonctionne pour dire bonjour ET au revoir ! C'est la salutation la plus courante entre amis et proches. Pratique quand on d√©bute en hongrois !
</CultureTip>

## Expressions du matin

| Hongrois | Prononciation | Fran√ßais |
|----------|---------------|----------|
| **J√≥ reggelt, kincsem!** | yo R√àG-g√®lt KIN-tch√®m | Bonjour, mon tr√©sor ! |
| **Hogy aludt√°l?** | hody O-lout-tal | Tu as bien dormi ? |
| **Sz√©p napot k√≠v√°nok!** | s√©ip NO-pot KII-va-nok | Je te souhaite une belle journ√©e ! |

## Expressions affectueuses

<VocabCard
  word="Nagyon √∂r√ºl√∂k, hogy l√°tlak!"
  translation="Je suis si content(e) de te voir !"
  pronunciation="NO-dyon EU-ru-leuk hody LAT-lok"
  example="Avec affection"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Hi√°nyozt√°l!"
  translation="Tu m'as manqu√© !"
  pronunciation="HI-an-yoz-tal"
  example="Apr√®s une s√©paration"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Nem akarok elmenni"
  translation="Je ne veux pas partir"
  pronunciation="n√®m O-ko-rok √àL-m√®n-ni"
  example="Expression romantique"
/>

<CTA />

articles.title: Lengyel kifejez√©sek vit√°khoz √©s n√©zetelt√©r√©sekhez
articles.content:
A lengyel √©s magyar kult√∫ra sok hasonl√≥s√°got mutat ‚Äì mindkett≈ë √©rt√©keli a melegs√©get √©s az ≈ëszintes√©get. Ha lengyel anyanyelv≈± partnered van, ezek a kifejez√©sek seg√≠tenek navig√°lni a neh√©z pillanatokat.

## A lengyel vitakult√∫ra

A lengyelek szenved√©lyesen fejezik ki magukat, de a csal√°d √©s a kapcsolatok szentek sz√°mukra. A vit√°k intenz√≠vek lehetnek, de a megb√©k√©l√©s is sz√≠vb≈ël j√∂n.

## Alapvet≈ë kifejez√©sek n√©zetelt√©r√©sekhez

### 1. "Czujƒô siƒô zraniony/zraniona, kiedy ty..."
**Kiejt√©s:** Csuj√© si√© zra≈àoni/zra≈àona, kjedi ti

**Jelent√©s:** B√°ntva √©rzem magam, amikor te...

**P√©lda:** "Czujƒô siƒô zraniona, kiedy nie oddzwaniasz."

### 2. "Czy mo≈ºemy o tym spokojnie porozmawiaƒá?"
**Kiejt√©s:** Csi mozsemi o tim szpokoj≈àe porozmavjacs

**Jelent√©s:** Besz√©lhet√ºnk err≈ël nyugodtan?
